task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the small plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows a robot arm, a pot with a lid, a small plate, and a spatula-like tool on a work surface. The robot first perceives the relevant objects, then opens (removes) the lid from the pot. After aligning to the pot, it grasps the pot from the top, transfers it, and places it onto the plate. Finally, leveraging the nearby spatula as a pushing aid, the robot pushes the pot forward toward the tableâ€™s front edge to achieve the final position.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are on the tabletop
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and align to pot
Pick pot with a top grasp
Push pot toward table front using spatula
success_criteria: Pot is resting on the plate stably
Pot is pushed toward and near the front edge of the table
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-detect or adjust viewpoint
If grasp slips, re-align and re-pick
If placement misses the plate, re-place with smaller tolerance
If push direction drifts, re-align push vector and repeat
task_long_description.termination: End when pot is on plate near the front edge and the robot has retreated safely.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Remove the lid from the pot.
Align end-effector to the pot for a stable grasp.
Release the pot on the plate.
Push pot toward the table front using spatula.

failure_modes: Push direction inaccurate causing pot to leave plate
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject with slight viewpoint change
Re-align using ApproachAndAlign and retry Pick
Re-issue PlaceOnSurface with same yaw but lower tolerance
Fallback to gentle manual nudge via end-effector if tool missing
assumptions: Front of table corresponds to image-bottom; mapped to direction_deg=180
Using OpenContainer with container_type='lid' approximates removing the pot lid
Spatula in frames is the intended tool
Plate can support the pot weight and size

expected_success_criteria: Pot translated forward relative to initial placement
